posts._title: Woody Allen – Don’t Drink the Water (1994)
posts.title: Don’t Drink the Water
posts.excerpt: The second film to be made from Woody Allen’s successful stage comedy (following a 1969 feature starring Jackie Gleason), Don’t Drink the Water is a made-for-television adaptation directed by and starring Allen himself. The fish-out-of-water premise remains the same: Allen plays Walter Hollander, a caterer from New Jersey who takes his family on vacation to …

posts._title: François Ozon – Action vérité aka Truth or Dare (1994)
posts.title: Action vérité
posts.excerpt: Innocence gives way to experience. Two girls and two boys, probably about 14 or 15 years old, play a game of truth or dare. posts.title: Eightball (1989-2004)
posts.excerpt: Eightball is an alternative comic book series written and drawn by Daniel Clowes. The first issue was published by Fantagraphics Books in 1989. It has, since the 1990s, consistently been among the best-selling independently authored comics. Alienation is a recurring theme in the series. Clowes is also known for nuanced dialog and character delineation that …

posts.title: Derek
posts.excerpt: Quote: An artist spends his or her existence examining life through their art, so why is it often so hard to use art to examine the artist’s life in turn? posts._title: Francesco Rosi – Uomini contro AKA Many Wars Ago (1970)
posts.title: Uomini contro
posts.excerpt: On the Italian/Austrian front during World War I, a disastrous Italian attack upon the Austrian positions leads to a mutiny among the decimated Italian troops. (IMDb)

posts.title: Kompozicija
posts.excerpt: An experimental film with no plot. Consists mostly of static shots portraying train wagons. The word COMPOSITION in Serbian has a triple meaning here – a train composition, composition of a shot, and music composition. Regarding the third meaning, the “soundtrack” of the film is a 5 second loop that keeps repeating itself over and …
